title: How to detect whether the source JPEG image has CMYK color space with SkiaSharp?
body:
I have a requirement to detect whether the input image has CMYK color space. How can I achieve this with SkiaSharp.

I tried to check `SKbitmap.ColorSpace`, but is is always null.
Then I tried to use `SKCodec.ColorSpace`, it is initialized, but even for CMYK `SKCodec.ColorSpace.Type` images it returns `SKColorSpaceType.Rgb`. 

Is there a way to to detect CYMK images with SkiaSharp?
